Sentencas: Twenty mol% gadolinium doped ceria powders were prepared by citrate-nitrate combustion synthesis technique.
Titulo: Nanocrystalline Gadolinium Doped Ceria: Combustion Synthesis and Electrical Characterization

Sentencas: Two different sources of cerium viz. cerium nitrate and ammonium ceric nitrate were used in different oxidant-to-fuel ratios.
Titulo: Nanocrystalline Gadolinium Doped Ceria: Combustion Synthesis and Electrical Characterization

Sentencas: The crystallite size of the synthesized powders ranged 5-27 nm was obtained depending on the preparation conditions with average particle size in the range 0.64-1.26 mu m.
Titulo: Nanocrystalline Gadolinium Doped Ceria: Combustion Synthesis and Electrical Characterization

Sentencas: Although, the powders were found to be agglomerated in nature, these powders were highly sinter-active as they showed very high sintered density (>= 95%) when sintered at 1250 degrees C having grain size in the range of 200-500 nm.
Titulo: Nanocrystalline Gadolinium Doped Ceria: Combustion Synthesis and Electrical Characterization

Sentencas: The electrical conductivity was found to depend on the temperature with two distinct regimes at a transition point of 350 degrees C.
Titulo: Nanocrystalline Gadolinium Doped Ceria: Combustion Synthesis and Electrical Characterization

Sentencas: The grain boundary showed a significant role in the total conductivity with its activation energy dependent on the material preparation conditions.
Titulo: Nanocrystalline Gadolinium Doped Ceria: Combustion Synthesis and Electrical Characterization

Sentencas: The activation energy of total conduction was found to be significantly low (similar to 0.5 eV) in the temperature range of 400-700 degrees C, this property is unique for application as an electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell operating in the low temperature range.
Titulo: Nanocrystalline Gadolinium Doped Ceria: Combustion Synthesis and Electrical Characterization

Sentencas: It was found that a fuel-deficient combustion reaction using cerium nitrate as the oxidant yielded the best quality powder which showed a maximum electrical conductivity of similar to 1.74 x 10(-2)
Titulo: Nanocrystalline Gadolinium Doped Ceria: Combustion Synthesis and Electrical Characterization
